description: From Middle English sorowy, equivalent to sorrow +‎ -y.

adjectives.description: sorrowy (comparative more sorrowy, superlative most sorrowy)

examples: With rev’rence I approach’d a hoary seer,
Who, bending o’er his crutch, seem’d lost in woe,
And many a sigh and many a sorrowy tear,
Spoke plain as words “Ah! whither can I go?”
